text: {{Infobox writer |name = David Lodge |honorific_suffix = CBE FRSL |image = |imagesize = |caption = |pseudonym = |birth_name = David John Lodge |birth_date = |birth_place = Brockley, London, England |death_date = |death_place = Birmingham, England |occupation = Writer, author, literary critic |period = |genre = |subject = |movement = |notableworks = |spouse = |partner = |children = |relatives = |influences = |influenced = |awards = |signature = |website = |portaldisp = }} David John Lodge, CBE, FRSL (28 January 1935 – 1 January 2025) was an English author and critic. He was a professor at the University of Birmingham until 1987. He was known for his "Campus Trilogy" – Changing Places: A Tale of Two Campuses (1975), Small World: An Academic Romance (1984) and Nice Work (1988). In 1992, he published The Art of Fiction. Lodge died in Birmingham, England on 1 January 2025, at the age of 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * David Lodge Biography Category:1935 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Writers from London Category:Critics
